content.processed:
Before departure

Firstly, find out what rules apply to you before entering a foreign country (e.g. PCR test, quarantine, etc.) on the Traveler's Map. Also, check the current hygiene measures at the airport (Václav Havel Airport).

Returning to the Czech Republic for Czech citizens 

Currently, following rules of entry into the Czech Republic are being applied: Without any conditions, it is possible to travel to the Czech Republic only from countries that are on the list of countries with a low risk of infection. If you have been in a country with a medium, high or very high risk of infection for more than 12 hours in the last 14 days (this category includes all countries not listed above), the following rules apply to you. 

Journey from countries with a medium risk of infection (orange):

  1. Fill in the arrival form before entering the Czech Republic.
  2. Undergo an antigen test no later than 24 hours or an PCR test no later than 72 hours before the trip to the Czech Republic (certification can be either in paper or electronical form).

Journey from countries with a high risk of infection (red):

  1. Fill in the arrival form before entering the Czech Republic.
  2. Undergo an antigen test no later than 24 hours or an PCR test no later than 72 hours before the trip to the Czech Republic (certification can be either in paper or electronical form).
  3. Within 5 days of arrival in the Czech Republic, undergo a PCR test and submit the result to the appropriate hygiene station. Until then, remain in quarantine.

Journey from countries with a very high risk of infection (dark red):

  1. Fill in the arrival form before entering the Czech Republic.
  2. Undergo an antigen test no later than 24 hours or an PCR test no later than 72 hours before the trip to the Czech Republic (certification can be either in paper or electronical form).
  3. Within 5 days of arrival in the Czech Republic, undergo a PCR test and submit the result to the appropriate hygiene station. Until then, remain in quarantine.

There are exceptions to these conditions. It does not apply, for example, to transit within 12 hours, international transport workers (holders of the certification), children under 5, cross-border workers and students (certified as a worker or student), for those EU citizens who have undergone covid-19 in the last 90 days and had an isolation ( with a certificate from a doctor) and for family members, companions of Czech citizens traveling with a Czech citizen, who have a diplomatic note issued by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs (certificate of covid-19 disease and isolation in a red or dark red country). Additional exceptions can be found in the current measure.

 For travel from all three groups of countries (orange, red, dark red), it is mandatory to wear an FFP2 respirator or at least a medical veil for 10 days after arrival in the Czech Republic.

The exact conditions for entry into the territory of the Czech Republic, including exceptions, can be found in English clearly in the table of the Ministry of the Interior of the Czech Republic.

For foreigners

Foreigners are prohibited from coming to the Czech Republic for reasons other than necessary. Necessary reasons include a trip to work and to do business, a profession, a trip back to their places of residence, a necessary trip to family or close relatives, a trip to leave the Czech Republic, provision of care for children or animals, basic trips to medical facilities and social services facilities, participation in a wedding or funeral, participation in education, including internships and exams. More informations can be found at current measures.

If you are traveling for any of the above reasons, proceed according to the obligations of foreigners when entering the Czech Republic.

Travel of foreigners on the territory of the Czech Republic for the purpose of tourism and recreation is not allowed.

Insurance

The Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Czech Republic recommends that you secure travel insurance before your trip, including medical expenses in the event of COVID-19.

Czech airports as transit airports

If the transit of an EU citizen does not exceed 12 hours, he does not have to fill in an electronic form or take a test. However, wearing at least an FFP2 class respirator or medical mask outside the home is mandatory.

All information for EU citizens and citizens of other countries can be found in this table.

Transit airports outside the Czech Republic

If you are traveling abroad and you have to change trains during your flight, look at the Traveler's map. The rules for transit should be written here. If this information is not explicitly written on the given page, contact the info line of the Ministry: +420 224 183 200 (available on MON-FRI from 08:00 - 16:00).
